main event: On September 24, 1962, a purply blue-white object, approximately the size of a football and 35 ft in diameter, was observed at an altitude of 15,000 ft over the Atlantic Ocean while moving westerly. It appeared like a ball of fire rotating slowly. The sighting, observed by crew and passengers, was considered as a meteor.
interesting points: The object was seen glowing in purply blue-white colors,It was reported to be about 35 ft in diameter,The object was at an altitude of 15,000 ft,Multiple witnesses included both crew and passengers of a flight,The sighting lasted for approximately 4 minutes and was later classified in various categories including unidentified.
sighted object: purply blue-white object resembling a ball of fire
witness description: crew and passengers of the flight
